content: 2 starting somewhere else work another round of double_crochet stitches again only into the back half of every stitch you won t need to count your stitches this time when you get to the corners work 2dc 2ch 2dc into the chain spaces again fasten_off at the end of the round round 3 this round is worked normally into both loops of the stitch join somewhere new with a slip_stitch make 2ch counts as a half_double_crochet and then work half trebles into every stitch and half_double_crochet 2ch half_double_crochet into the corners finish with a slip_stitch into the top of the starting chain if you look closely you should be able to see the two ridges from rounds 1 and 2 which match those between the squares i did take a photo but including it here would have been no help to you at all rounds 4 - 6 these three rounds are all worked in half trebles miss the first stitch on each side and work half_double_crochet 2ch half_double_crochet into the corner spaces 16 round 7 for this final round the half trebles are replaced with front raised double_crochet stitches work a double_crochet in the normal way but insert the hook from the front to the back and then to the front again round the stem of the next stitch remember that i use uk crochet terms this is the same stitch as front raised single_crochet in us terminology so work frdc round every stitch and double_crochet 2ch double_crochet in the corners this gives the edge of the blanket a slightly chunkier look which helps it to keep its shape now you can block your finished blanket and admire it i m considering using mine as a rug - all those bright colours and lots of black to hide the dirt 17 abbreviations sts stitches chain chain slip_stitch slip_stitch double_crochet double_crochet us single_crochet half_double_crochet half treble us half_double_crochet treble_crochet treble us double_crochet frdc front raised double_crochet us front raised single_crochet this stitch is explained on page 17 a final word when i am working on a design i often print out what elizabeth zimmermann might call pithy instructions on a single sheet of paper to carry around and refer to as i work as the instructions for the squares are picture heavy and rather long- winded i thought you might like these notes separately for this pattern they are on the following page for you to print and put in your project bag © frankie brown 2022 mypatterns areforpersonaluseonlyandshouldnotbeusedtomakeitems forsale pleasedonotusethemforteachingpurposes withoutmypermission 18 starburst squares - the pithy directions stylecraft special dk 295 m / 100g and 3 5 mm hook alternate black and colours three per square three rounds of the first colour followed by two each of the next two all corners are worked as double_crochet 2ch double_crochet change colour with a slip stitch after joining to the first corner of last round after round 3 instructions are for one side only all double_crochet stitches on the sides
